result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. Sexton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $200 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:15 p.m. Defendant William J. Sexton in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders - Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.
to defendant regarding bond-to be signed and returned to COC.

Pre-trial conference at 04-01-2015 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-14-2015 02:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:37 PM: Defendant William J. Sexton in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not want counsel.  NGP received and entered.   PTC - P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and finds probable cause as to each specific charge.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
